message.entry: Input data contains a category named ''{0}'', which conflicts with the use of 'ShowOthers'. Use renamecats to rename ''{0}'' to another category name.
BinCounts must be a vector of length equal to length(Categories).
Length of ''Categories'' and length of ''BinCounts'' must be equal.
When ''BinCountsMode'' is set to ''manual'', ''BinCounts'' must be set.
CATEGORIES must be a categorical vector, a string vector, or a cell array of character vectors.
All category names must form a vector of strings or a cell vector of character vectors.
Codes must have the same length as the number of categories.
''DisplayOrder'' value must be ''ascend'', ''descend'', or ''data''.
Invalid input combination. Specify either a list of categories or ''NumDisplayBins'', but not both.
Specify the ''Categories'' parameter as the first argument, then specify a value for ''BinCounts''.
Histograms of ordinal categorical arrays on the same axes must have the same categories.
When assigning to the Data property, the old and new ordinal Data must have the same categories in the same order.
Histograms of ordinal and non-ordinal categorical arrays cannot be plotted on the same axes.
When assigning to the Data property, the old and new Data must both be ordinal, or both non-ordinal
Histograms of categorical arrays with different orientations cannot be plotted on the same axes.
Plotting a histogram of categorical data into polar axes is not supported.
Input must be a categorical array.
When ''BinCountsMode'' is set to ''auto'', ''BinCounts'' cannot be set.
CATEGORIES must be a vector or empty.
''NumDisplayBins'' is not supported when ''BinCounts'' is specified.
''NumDisplayBins'' value must be less than or equal to the number of categories in the data.
When X and CATEGORIES are both ordinal arrays, they must have the same categories in the same order.
X and CATEGORIES must both be ordinal or not ordinal.
Orientation is not supported for categorical data when there are non-histogram objects in the axes.
Changing the ''Orientation'' value is not supported for histograms with categorical data in two y-axes.
Categories must be unique.
Expected input number {0,number,integer}, ShowOthers, to be a scalar matching one of these values:\n\n''on'', ''off'', true, false, matlab.lang.OnOffSwitchState.on, matlab.lang.OnOffSwitchState.off.
Displaying ''Others'' bar is not supported when ''BinCounts'' is specified.
CATEGORIES contains categories not present in X.
fewerbins method is not supported in histograms of categorical data.
morebins method is not supported in histograms of categorical data.
Toggle to show empty bins
Number of bins
Category
Value
